page.title: 05THE WALSGRAVE HOSPITAL
page.content: The Walsgrave Hospital is a major development for health care in Wyken.It has five floors and four major units.They are the Maternity Unit,the Geriatric Unit,the General Unit and the Psychiatric Unit. The Maternity Unit was opened in 1966 and has 203 beds including a 29 cot special care unit.It also includes the Maternity training school. The General Unit was opened in 1969 and has 598 beds.It has a number of specialist departments and 10 operating theatres. The Psychiatric Unit was opened in 1973 and has 263 beds with a 50 place day hospital. In the east wing of the hospital is the chapel which holds a service on Sundays.
